org.svvrl.goal.cmd
Class CommandExpression

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.cmd.AbstractExpression
      org.svvrl.goal.cmd.CommandExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
Expression
Direct Known Subclasses:
AccCommand, AlphabetCommand, AperiodicCommand, BatchCommand, ClassificationCommand, CloneCommand, CloseCommand, ComplementExpression, ConcatenationCommand, ContainmentCommand, ConvertCommand, DeterministicCommand, DeterminizationCommand, EchoCommand, EmptinessCommand, EquivalenceCommand, GenerateCommand, HomomorphismCommand, InputTestCommand, IntersectionCommand, IsomorphismCommand, LayoutCommand, LoadCommand, MinimizationCommand, NamesCommand, OmegaCommand, OpenCommand, ParityCommand, PreferenceCommand, ProductCommand, PromelaCommand, PropertyCommand, QPTLCommand, ReadlineCommand, ReduceCommand, ReplaceCommand, RepositoryCommand, ReverseCommand, SatisfiabilityCommand, SaveCommand, SeparationCommand, SeqCommand, SimplifyCommand, SimulatedCommand, SimulationEquivalenceCommand, SleepCommand, SolveExtension.SolveCommand, SplitCommand, StatCommand, TestCommand, TranslateCommand, UnionCommand, ValidityCommand
public abstract class CommandExpression
extends AbstractExpression

A CommandExpression is an expression formed by a command name and arguments for the command. An object of this class corresponds to an invocation of the command. The name of the command can be set in plugin.xml or in this class. The arguments of the command are divided into two groups, namely static arguments and runtime arguments. Static arguments are parsed in setArguments(List) during parse time. Runtime arguments are always of the form --option arg where arg is parsed in eval(Context) right before the execution of this command. For example, cmd -a -b --option "-c -d" file is equivalent to cmd -a -b -c -d file. In this case, the runtime argument "-c -d" can be a variable with a value determined during the execution of GOAL commands.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

setArguments

public void setArguments(java.util.List<Expression> args)
                  throws EvaluationException
Sets the arguments of this command and parses the static ones of the arguments. Note that this function does not reset previous arguments. However, this function will overwritten the specified arguments.

Parameters:
args - arguments of this command
Throws:
EvaluationException - if some static argument is not accepted by this command

eval

public final java.lang.Object eval(Context ctx)
                            throws EvaluationException
This function first parses and configures this command based on the runtime arguments of this command. After that, this function will invoke execute(Context).

Parameters:
ctx - a context
Returns:
the result of evaluating this expression in the context ctx
Throws:
EvaluationException - if there is an error in evaluating this expression
